CATROID-769 Add join function for three strings in formulaeditor

timeline.author: wslany

replies.bodyText: refactored JOIN -> JOIN2 and used JOIN3 for new functionality
replies.author: christophsiegl

timeline.author: wslany
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1788,6 +1788,8 @@ needs read and write access to it. You can always change permissions through you
     <string name="formula_editor_function_letter_parameter">(1,\'hello world\')</string>
     <string name="formula_editor_function_join">join</string>
     <string name="formula_editor_function_join_parameter">(\'hello\',\' world\')</string>
+    <string name="formula_editor_function_join2">join2</string>
+    <string name="formula_editor_function_join2_parameter">(\'hello\',\' world\',\' !\')</string>

timeline.author: wslany

replies.bodyText: Unfortunately I have no time left. Please create a separate ticket.
replies.author: christophsiegl

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                <string name="formula_editor_function_join2">join2</string>
          
          
            
                <string name="formula_editor_function_join3">join</string>
          
      
    
    
  

No need to give it a different visual name from a user's perspective. That's also how it was specified in the ticket.
timeline.author: wslany
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1788,6 +1788,8 @@ needs read and write access to it. You can always change permissions through you
     <string name="formula_editor_function_letter_parameter">(1,\'hello world\')</string>
     <string name="formula_editor_function_join">join</string>
     <string name="formula_editor_function_join_parameter">(\'hello\',\' world\')</string>
+    <string name="formula_editor_function_join2">join2</string>
